ETYMOLOGY: Compound of 'side' (from Old English 'sīde', meaning 'flank, side of a body') and 'walk' (from Old English 'wealcan', meaning 'to roll, turn, move about'). Literally, a 'walk at the side' of something.

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: noun: a word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun).
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A paved or asphalted path for people to walk on, usually found at the side of a road or street.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 人行道，通常指在道路或街道旁边供行人行走的铺砌路面。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please keep your dog on a leash when walking on the sidewalk.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 在人行道上遛狗时请牵好狗绳。

REGISTER: Common (predominantly North American usage; 'pavement' is more common in British English)
